Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior glazed, fired yellowish-green; from top: two added white lines; white lotus bud with added red centre and tendrils; white dot and billet pattern between white lines; exterior: mostly reserved; two dilute lines above painted decoration consisting of hand of a komast or female figure holding a wreath, to left.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the wreath, see British Museum 1924,1201.382.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 297, no. 987, pl. 137)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1974) (phase 2)
